alert.note: Alert for Cheshire (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 5:49PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Cheshire County through 615 PM EDT... At 549 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Westmoreland, or 7 miles south of Bellows Falls. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Walpole, Surry, Westmoreland, and Alstead. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
